After my Alma Mater defeated #3 Louisville to remain undefeated, where should they be placed in the BCS polls?
 
 Rutgers Song:
 Alma Mater
 
 My father sent me to old Rutgers,
 And resolv'd that I should be a man;
 And so I settled down,
 In that noisy college town,
 On the banks of the old Raritan.
 (Chorus) 
 
 Chorus...
 On the banks of the old Raritan (my friends)
 Where old Rutgers evermore shall stand,
 For has she not stood
 Since the time of the flood,
 On the banks of the old Raritan.
 
 Her ardent spirit stirred and cheered me
 From the day me college years began;
 Gracious Alma Mater mine;
 Learning's fair and honored shrine;
 On the banks of the old Raritan.
 (Chorus)
 
 I love her flaming far-flung banner
 I love her triumphs proud to scan,
 And I glory in her fame
 That's immortalized her name.
 On the banks of the old Raritan.
 (Chorus)
 
 My heart clings closer than the ivy
 As life runs out its fleeting span,
 To the stately, ancient walls
 Of her hallowed, classic halls
 On the banks of the old Raritan.
 (Chorus)
 
 Then sing aloud to Alma Mater;
 And keep the Scarlet in the van;
 For with her motto high
 Rutgers' name shall never die,
 On the banks of the old Raritan.
 (Chorus)

After my Alma Mater defeated #3 Louisville to remain undefeated, where should they be placed in the BCS polls?

 Big shakeups are due in the top 15 this week. Let's see how all the teams fare by day's end.

Big shakeups are due in the top 15 this week. Let's see how all the teams fare by day's end.

 
 Yep. Florida won a squeaker against an unranked SC. Auburn lost to Georgia. Both should head south, IMO. emoticon_xgood

Yep. Florida won a squeaker against an unranked SC. Auburn lost to Georgia. Both should head south, IMO. emoticon_xgood

 #3 Louisville lost to Rutgers.
 #4 Florida squeaked out a win against underrated -- but, yes unranked -- USC (no, the other USC).
 #5 Texas lost to unranked Kansas State.
 #6 Auburn lost (badly) to reeling Georgia.
 #8 California fell to unranked Arizona.
 Injury riddled #11 Arkansas got huge press this weekend en route to whalloping #16 Tennessee.
 
 Rutgers picked the wrong weekend to make headlines. With all the losses to dogs (and 'Dawgs), significant defeats (and wins) will be underemphasized.
 
 I predict Florida slides up to the #3 spot despite the close game because -- after all -- a win's a win, and I doubt voters will penalize them much if at all. Voters may end up "preferring USC" if the Trojans shellac Oregon, rather than "penalize Florida." Rutgers will undoubtedly jump several spots, and Arkansas will get some overdue attention and break the top 10, finally outranking Auburn, who they defeated handily earlier in the season. However, I suspect Texas won't fall far, with some of the explanations being that McCoy was out and Texas still nearly came back.
 
 Pending a USC victory, I predict that Monday's BCS top ten will look like the following. Note that this is not necessarily how I would actually rank them.
 
 1. Ohio State
 2. Michigan
 3. Florida (/USC)
 4. USC (/Florida)
 5. Notre Dame
 6. Rutgers
 7. Louisville
 8. West Virginia
 9. Arkansas
 10. Texas
 
 Then perhaps
 11. LSU
 12. Boise State
 13. California
 14. Auburn
 15. Wisconsin (?)
 
 I had Arkansas at #10 (behind Texas), because I don't see the computers being as kind to them, nor do I see the voters being too hard on Texas. However, the computers are already unkind (relatively speaking) to Texas, and with the ESPN press and McFadden/Hog-mania catching on (not to mention the Vol stomping), the voters will probably favor Arkansas.

 I had Arkansas at #10 (behind Texas), because I don't see the computers being as kind to them, nor do I see the voters being too hard on Texas. However, the computers are already unkind (relatively speaking) to Texas, and with the ESPN press and McFadden/Hog-mania catching on (not to mention the Vol stomping), the voters will probably favor Arkansas.

 
 
 That's a pretty thorough analysis and I bet not far from what will happen. emoticon_xgood emoticon_xgood

Maybe I mixed a bit too much human with computer.
 
 I'm pleasantly surprised that Arkansas made as big a jump as it did, although I'm skeptical that they're as good as the teams near them in the rankings. It does make perfect sense that voters liked them, after all the press. They're down at #9 in the computers.
 
 Rutgers is, amazingly, #2 in the computers.
 
 USC and Florida, as I guessed, are pretty much neck and neck in the human polls. Puny humans.
 
 The computers are still being a bit unkind to #8 West Virginia.
 
 Meanwhile, Wisconsin made a big jump as well, and probably deservedly so. Still, Louisville (#10) has them beaten by one slot according to the computers, even though their only loss is to now #6 Rutgers, and they beat WVU.
 
 I'm quite surprised that Texas took such a big hit, though that doesn't mean I'm unhappy that Texas took such a big hit...
 
 The next two weeks should be interesting.
 Ohio State plays Michigan next week; the loser may drop, but some are saying that a close game may not result in an opening at #2.
 USC will play Cal this week. Cal's already out, but they could play spoiler.
 USC will play Notre Dame in two weeks. The loser will drop out of contention, if they aren't by the time they get there.
 In only slightly less interesting news, Arkansas will play LSU. Another win for Arkansas might push them up. Assuming they win either of their two next games, they'll play Florida in the SEC championship game, which will be great for the winner and disastrous for the loser. Needless to say, the Hogs will be rooting for Cal over USC, then USC over Notre Dame.

title: 4Forums.com Political Debates and Polls -  Where should Rutgers be Ranked?
